critique: This ECG shows an acute inferior myocardial infarction (Option B), with ST-segment elevations in the inferior leads (II, III, and aVF) and reciprocal changes (ST-segment depressions) in lead aVL. There is also subtle ST-segment elevation in leads V5 and V6.
educational_objective: Identify an inferior myocardial infarction on ECG.
question_stem: Which of the following abnormalities is demonstrated on this patient's ECG?
question_text: A 48-year-old woman is evaluated for dyspnea associated with nausea and diaphoresis.ECG is shown.
